message.content:
{"id": "50059", 
"title": "Resources not served from /WEB-INF/lib/{.jar}/META-INF/resources if metadatacomplete=\"true\" is set in web.xml", 
"description": "Bug 50059: Resources are not served from /WEB-INF/lib/{.jar}/META-INF/resources if metadatacomplete=\"true\" is set in web.xml. Make a Servlet 3.0 web app called 'foo' with the metadatacomplete=\"true\" attribute set on the webapp element in the /WEB-INF/web.xml.",
"OB": "Resources should be served from /WEB-INF/lib/{.jar}/META-INF/resources when metadatacomplete=\"true\" is set in web.xml.",
"EB": "Resources are not being served from /WEB-INF/lib/{.jar}/META-INF/resources when metadatacomplete=\"true\" is set in web.xml.",
"SR": "To reproduce the issue: 
1. Create a jar file containing a single /META-INF/resources/index.html file.
2. Start the web app in Tomcat 7.0.2.
3. In a browser, go to http://localhost:8080/foo/index.html.
Expected result: A 200 response and the index.html file should be served.
Actual result: A 404 response.
If you modify the web.xml file to set metadatacomplete=\"false\" and restart the app, accessing /foo/index.html will work as expected.
Note: The issue does not occur when using Glassfish v3.0.1."}

origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '50059', 'title': 'Bug 50059Resources are not served from /WEBINF/lib/{.jar}/METAINF/resources if metadatacomplete="true" is set in web.xml', 'description': 'Bug 50059Resources are not served from /WEBINF/lib/{.jar}/METAINF/resources if metadatacomplete="true" is set in web.xml Make a Servlet 3.0 webapp (lets name it foo) with metadatacomplete="true" attribute set on the webapp element in the /WEBIBNF/web.xml.2. ', 'OB': '', 'EB': '', 'SR': 'To reproduce:1. Make a jar holding a single /METAINF/resources/index.html file. Start the web app in Tomcat 7.0.2 and in browser go to http://localhost:8080/foo/index.html.Expected result: 200 response and index.html served.Actual result: 404If you modify the web.xml to metadatacomplete="false" and restart the app now /foo/index.html will respond as expected.I tried the same webapp with Glassfish v3.0.1 and it works as expected regardless what I set in metadatacomplete attribute.I made a quick look in the servlet 3.0 spec and as far as I can see metadatacomplete only regulates annotation and web fragment processing. '}
